output.title: The Rise and Fall of Blockbuster: How Netflix Changed Entertainment Forever
output.caption: From VHS to streaming, witness the era of giants.
output.resume: This is a dramatic retelling of how Netflix revolutionized entertainment at the expense of Blockbuster.

scenes.script: Once upon a time, in an era dominated by physical media, there was one name that reigned supreme: Blockbuster.
scenes.image_prompt: A shot of the iconic Blockbuster logo and storefront

scenes.script: I remember as a kid, Saturday nights were for heading down to the local Blockbuster. The smell of fresh popcorn, the towering shelves of movies... It was magic.
scenes.image_prompt: David reminiscing in an empty Blockbuster store

scenes.script: But even back then, there were rumblings of change. This new thing called 'DVDs' was coming out. And with it, a tiny startup called Netflix.
scenes.image_prompt: Lucy looking at old newspapers and magazines featuring DVDs

scenes.script: Netflix started as a mail-order service, offering DVDs by post for a monthly subscription fee. It was convenient, but it wasn't yet the disruptor we know today.
Then one day, they announced they were going digital. I thought, 'Why would anyone want to watch a movie on their computer?' Little did I know...
scenes.image_prompt: David laughing at his old self

scenes.script: With the launch of streaming, Netflix changed everything. No more waiting for movies to arrive in the mail. Now, they were just a click away.
scenes.image_prompt: Lucy clicking on a movie on her laptop

scenes.script: Blockbuster tried to fight back with their own online rental service. But it was too little, too late. The writing was already on the wall.
scenes.image_prompt: A struggling Blockbuster employee trying to use an old computer

scenes.script: The last Blockbuster store closed its doors in 2018. An era had ended. But as we mourned the past, we couldn't deny that Netflix had changed entertainment forever.
scenes.image_prompt: David standing outside the last Blockbuster store
